abstract.text: The keys used in key-value pairs to specify the value of number formatter properties.

inlineContent.text: The values for these keys are all
objects. The specific types for each key are specified above.

abstract.text: The original format string for the formatter (given the date and time style and locale specified at creation), a
Specifies the minus sign suffix symbol to use when placing a formatted number within a string, a
Specifies the width of a formatted number within a string that is either left justified or right justified based on the value of
Specifies the international currency symbol to use when placing a formatted number within a string, a
Specifies whether the formatter is lenient, a
Specifies the plus sign prefix symbol to use when placing a formatted number within a string, a
Specifies the per mill (1/1000) symbol to use when placing a formatted number within a string, a
Specifies the plus sign suffix symbol to use when placing a formatted number within a string, a
Specifies how the last digit is rounded, as when
is rounded to three decimal places, as in
Specifies the minimum number of integer digits before a decimal point, a
Specifies a positive rounding increment, or
Specifies the string that is used to represent the symbol for infinity, a
Specifies if the result of converting a value to a string should always contain the decimal separator, even if the number is an integer.
Specifies the whether the formatter uses significant digits, a
Specifies the minimum number of digits after a decimal point, a
Specifies the minimum number of significant digits to use, a
Specifies if the grouping separator should be used, a
Specifies the symbol for the minus sign, a
Specifies the padding character to use when placing a formatted number within a string, a
Specifies how often the “thousands” or grouping separator appears, as in “10,000,000”, a
Specifies the string that is used to represent zero, a
Specifies the exponent symbol (“E” or “e”) in the scientific notation of numbers (for example, as in
Specifies how often the secondary grouping separator appears, a
Specifies the symbol for the currency, a
Specifies the position of a formatted number within a string, a
Specifies the minus sign prefix symbol to use when placing a formatted number within a string, a
Specifies the grouping symbol to use when placing a currency value within a string, a
Specifies the string that is used to represent the percent symbol, a
Specifies the maximum number of integer digits before a decimal point, a
Specifies the maximum number of digits after a decimal point, a
Specifies the symbol for the plus sign, a
Specifies the string that is used to represent NaN (“not a number”) when values are converted to strings, a
Specifies the currency decimal separator, a
Specifies the maximum number of significant digits to use, a
Specifies the multiplier to use when placing a formatted number within a string, a
